description.narrative: The Accountable Entity's, the Millennium Challenge Account (MCA) Morocco, administrative costs, which include staff salaries, financial audits, and fiscal and procurement agent fees.

condition.narrative: 1) Delivery of a complete, correct and fully executed CIF Disbursement Request for the relevant CIF Disbursement Period.
10) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after July 31, 2008, the Government shall have established a bid challenge system acceptable to MCC.
11) Submission to and approval by, MCC of a CIF Financial Plan and Quarterly Financial Report
12) A CIF Procurement Plan, approved by MCC, is currently in force.
13) Proof, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, that all Compact Implementation Funding shall be free from Taxes as anticipated by Section 2.7 of the Compact.

14) Prior to each CIF Disbursement, MCA-Morocco shall ensure that an interim Environmental and Social Impact (ESI) director has been selected and remains engaged until a permanent ESI director is hired.

15) With respect to any CIF Disbursement, MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that the Government has committed funds for the initial census of occupants at Place Lalla Ydouna and for the urgent preliminary works during the CIF period at the Makina and the fondouks, as required under Paragraph D.7 of Annex I to the Compact.

16) The Government shall cause the appropriate governmental ministry or body to issue one or more tax exemption letter(s) (or other appropriate documentary evidence) to the Accountable Entity evidencing such exemption from Taxes, as promptly as possible and in no event later than the date of the initial Disbursement of Compact Implementation Funding.

17) Within ninety (90) days after the Effective Date of this Agreement, the Government will provide to MCC written evidence, satisfactory to MCC, of the existence of specific operational procedures the Government will use to ensure that each Tax MCC identifies in writing is not applied to the Section 2.7 Items, along with a description of the legal basis for Government use of such procedures.

2) MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that (a) the activity being funded by such CIF Disbursement is necessary, advisable or is otherwise consistent with the goal of facilitating the implementation of the Compact, (b) there has been no violation of, and the use of requested funds for purposes requested will not violate, the limitations on use or treatment of Compact Implementation Funding, and (c) MCA-Morocco and the Government will have substantially complied with its obligations and covenants as set forth in the CIF Agreement (including all covenants set forth in Attachment II).
3) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after March 15, 2008 MCA-Morocco is fully formed and in good standing under the laws of Morocco.

4) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after April 15, 2008, MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that MCA-Morocco is sufficiently mobilized (including, without limitation, having hired all key personnel as identified by MCC) in order for MCA-Morocco to be able to fully perform the obligations of MCA-Morocco as described in the CIF Agreement.

5) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after sixty (60) days after MCA-Morocco is fully formed and in good standing under the laws of Morocco, a Bank Agreement has been executed and delivered by MCA-Morocco and TGR, and is in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default has occurred or is continuing there under.

6) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after sixty (60) days after MCA-Morocco is fully formed and in good standing under the laws of Morocco, MCA-Morocco has executed and delivered to MCC a contract with an individual to act as the chief financial officer of MCA-Morocco, which individual is subject to MCC approval and which contract must be in full force and effect and in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

7) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after thirty (60) days after MCA-Morocco is fully formed and in good standing under the laws of Morocco, a Fiscal Agent Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, has been signed by MCA-Morocco and a fiscal agent acceptable to MCC, and is in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default has occurred or is continuing there under.

8) With respect to any CIF Disbursement on or after July 31, 2008, a Procurement Agent Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, has been signed by MCA-Morocco and a procurement agent acceptable to MCC, and is in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default has occurred or is continuing there under.

9) Prior to the deposit of any CIF Disbursement into the Permitted Account in accordance with an approved CIF Disbursement Request, MCC will have received satisfactory evidence of the establishment of the Permitted Account.
